intro: Pentachaeta exilis, commonly known as the slender pentachaeta, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. Its slender stems and compact growth habit make it well adapted to arid environments.
